channel.title: My Mom Messed Up
channel.description:
ok hey everyone well i was on my computer today and my mom came and got me and said "um how do i get into my account on the computer, i kinda forgot my password" the guest account is enabled iv tried the following
1. changing the pass Using "Run..." 2. going to control panel>explore>admin tools and changing it there
in both i was denied access, is there somthing i can do without like re-formating.

item.title: My Mom Messed Up
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

“2. going to control panel>explore>admin tools and changing it there”

I’m pretty sure if he can get onto the admin tools he therefor is an admin account on his account and thus, no need for the extra administrator account safe more provides.

leader, Search google for “System account”. It is a account that only lasts until you logoff that is a super-admin. Windows doesn’t log it’s usage, nor know of it.

Read full topic

item.title: My Mom Messed Up
item.dc:creator: @Kryptizzler Kryptizzler
item.description:
@Kryptizzler wrote:

Go safe mode like leader said.

Read full topic

item.title: My Mom Messed Up
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

The Un-Named:

Search the forum/google for system account. The temp. system account can change admin’s passes.

What temp. system account?

Read full topic

@The_Un-Named wrote:

Search the forum/google for system account. The temp. system account can change admin’s passes.

item.title: My Mom Messed Up
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

[quote=“mvp566, post:1, topic:26684”]ok hey everyone well i was on my computer today and my mom came and got me and said “um how do i get into my account on the computer, i kinda forgot my password” the guest account is enabled iv tried the following

  1. changing the pass Using “Run…”
  2. going to control panel>explore>admin tools and changing it there

in both i was denied access, is there somthing i can do without like re-formating.[/quote]

Yes, you can go to safe mode. Then log onto the administrator account, and create a new account. Simple as that :).

To go onto safe mode do the following:

  1. Restart your computer
  2. Press f8 or f10
  3. Select safe mode

Read full topic
